Dracona looked behind her and noticed Carnage..... "who is that?...." she
asked Teltoli and Silverbolt....
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage Dinobot" <carnage@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 17, 2000 10:14 AM
Subject: Re: Neo Beast wars


>
> * Carnage continued through the forest, nothing in particular to do. She
was through thinking about her dead friend and a new subject had popped into
mind, after killing Megatron...what would she do?
> She had thought long and hard about it but had come up empty clawed. The
Maximals didn't seem to bad, besides the fact that she thought that their
leader was either a coward and just plain under trained, the
Predacons...that was just a joke! She had learned her lesson about the
Predacons, they were cheats, murderers and scoundrels and she wanted nothing
to do with them, but the Alliance. In order to become an Alliance member she
would have to end up trying to kill both Maximals and Predacons...that
wasn't her style.
> So in plain, being Neutral was the best thing to stick with so far...so
far.
> Carnage sighed as she came to a middle sized lake, she wandered over to
the edge of it and dipped her snout in for a drink. The water was cool and
she drank well, but just as she was about to pull her snout from the water
she happened to look up and...
> She saw Teltoli conversing with a Dragon and the Fuzor she had seen back
at the Ark. (SilverBolt.)
> Carnage looked at the dragon carefully, for some particular reason she had
a bad feeling about it.
> She slowly backed into the brush in which she had come and slowly began to
make her way towards the group, the Maxtrix forbid if Teltoli ever got
hurt...she was her friend and that was the last thing that she wanted to
happen.
> It wasn't long before Carnage had made her way all the way behind the
group and then crouched low in the bushes, she evened her breath to a low
tolerance and didn't move a muscle. There was no chance in the Pit that any
of them could know that she was there.
> In truth she was only 50 metres away from the dragonbot and she didn't
plan to get any closer, or hoped that it didn't come to her getting closer.
> She waited, she couldn't hear their conversation so it couldn't really be
called ease dropping.
> Carnage set her head on her front limbs and settled down, all things would
come in time.
> But until she was sure that the dragon wasn't threatening she wasn't about
to leave either.
> Her friend's very life could be depending on it.*
>
>
